title: Authentication
description: HdRezkaApi supports optional user login via email and password.

sections.title: HdRezkaApi.login
sections.description: Return True on success and raise Exception on fail.

items.title: raise_exception
items.description: Raise `LoginFailed` exception if login fails (default: True).

sections.title: HdRezkaSession
sections.description: Context manager wrapper for reusing headers, proxies, cookies, and translator preferences across multiple pages.

items.title: origin
items.description: Base domain (e.g. `https://rezka.ag`) to use in login and relative URL resolving.

items.title: login(email, password)
items.description: Attempts to login using stored `origin`. Sets `cookies` if successful. [More](#/session.login_base)
items.code:
from HdRezkaApi import HdRezkaSession

with HdRezkaSession('https://rezka.ag/') as session:
    session.login('email@gmail.com', 'password')

items.title: get(url)
items.description: Creates an `HdRezkaApi` object for the provided URL, with session settings.
items.code:
from HdRezkaApi import HdRezkaSession

with HdRezkaSession('https://rezka.ag/') as session:
    rezka = session.get('https://hdrezka.ag/series/thriller/47-sherlok-2010.html')
    print(rezka.name)

items.description:
You can specify origin to make requests to a same site.

In the next example, the request will be made to the url: `https://rezka_mirror.com/__YOUR_URL__.html`
items.code:
from HdRezkaApi import HdRezkaSession

with HdRezkaSession('https://rezka_mirror.com/') as session:
    rezka = session.get('https://hdrezka.ag/__URL_PATH__.html')
    rezka = session.get('__URL_PATH__.html')

items.description:
You can do not specify origin and then requests will be made to the URL you specified.

But then you won't be able to use `login()`.
items.code:
from HdRezkaApi import HdRezkaSession

with HdRezkaSession() as session:
    rezka = session.get('https://hdrezka.ag/__URL_PATH__.html')
with HdRezkaSession(cookies=cookies, headers=headers, proxy=proxy) as session:
